intro: Parsonsia marginata, commonly known as the golden flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking orange to yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. Its showy inflorescences consist of clusters of tubular flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. Parsonsia marginata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
